Annotation.note:
The side $BC$ of the triangle $ABC$ touches the incircle $(I)$ in $X$ and the excircle $(J)$ relative to $BC$ in $Y$. Show that the line $AY$ passes through the diametric opposite $Z$ of $X$ on $(I)$. State a similar proposition about the diametric opposite of $Y$ on $(J)$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
